author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Travel warning for Birmingham train travelers this weekend - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Travel warning for Birmingham train travelers this weekend Published on : Saturday, September 26, 2015
A weekend train trip to Birmingham this weekend will be a difficult task for travelers. British Transport Department reports that almost half-a-million travelers are expected to head towards Birmingham for various high-profile events. The weekend is believed to be the busiest weekend since the 2012 Olympics.
Visitors to Birmingham are heading to a variety of events including the likes of Rugby World Cup match at Villa Park, English Premier League football matches and the opening weekend at the transformed New Street station along with the Grand Central shopping complex.
According to the British Transport Police, more than 350,000 passengers are expected to pass through the newly-redeveloped New Street Station – more than double the total for a busy working day.
There will be extra protection officers on duty responsible for keeping the city’s transport in good shape. Travelers are urged to plan ahead and look after their property while traveling.
